Pirate Radio

Release dates:

Episode 1: 21st January 2010
Episode 2: 3rd February 2010
Episode 3: 15th February 2010
Episode 4: 22nd February 2010
Episode 5: 8th April 2011

This series of radio shows hosted by Murdoc were released through the Gorillaz website to generate hype for Plastic Beach, with an additional fifth episode released to promote The Fall; along with a longer version of the episode you could unlock by finishing a web game.

Episodes:

Episode 1
Episode 2
Episode 3
Episode 4
Episode 5 The Fall Review
iTunes Interview

Release date: 22nd October 2010

Where to listen: https://music.apple.com/us/album/itunes-session/693778034

This interview was the ninth and final track from the US-only iTunes Session EP. It features Murdoc & 2D discussing the history of the band, along with track-by-track conversations about the songs performed for the EP.

The Fall Pirate Radio Show

Release dates:

Gorillaz Pirate Radio Take Over: 15th April 2011
Gorillaz The Fall Pirate Radio Show: 18th April 2011

Where to listen: https://open.spotify.com/playlist/66U4OtwxW2lfuz932fI62u

Released only in the UK, this pirate radio show was made to promote The Fall’s commercial release; hosted by Murdoc. Parlophone’s Spotify account released a playlist of the full show, whilst Gorillaz’ Spotify account released the spoken segments as an album. This is a playlist version of Pirate Radio – Episode 5 The Fall Review ( short ).

*These tracks make up the Gorillaz Pirate Radio Take Over album.

^The inclusion of this track in the playlist is a mistake, as the song is included in a track off the Gorillaz Pirate Radio Take Over album.

We Are 10

Release dates:

Gorillaz Are Ten (Spotify Radio Show 1): 25th November 2011
Gorillaz Are Ten (Spotify Radio Show 2): 28th November 2011
Gorillaz Are Ten (Spotify Radio Show 3): 9th December 2011
Gorillaz We Are Ten Radio Show: 13th December 2011

Where to listen: https://open.spotify.com/playlist/0pdJoG6jHjRYYGSqs9lCbi

This pirate radio show was done in celebration of the band’s tenth anniversary; hosted by Murdoc. Parlophone’s Spotify account released a playlist of the full show, whilst Gorillaz’ Spotify account released the spoken segments as three separate albums.

Murdoc Gorillaz

Release dates:

Transmission 1: 31st January 2012
Transmission 2: 5th February 2012
Transmission 3: 8th February 2012
Transmission 4: 13th February 2012
Transmission 5: 21st February 2012
Transmission 6: 24th February 2012
Transmission 7: 27th February 2012
Transmission 8: 28th February 2012
Transmissions 9-10: 29th February 2012

Where to listen: https://soundcloud.com/murdocgorillaz

Murdoc started his own SoundCloud account near the end of Phase 3 to promote DoYaThing via pirate radio, wrapping up the phase and becoming the final piece of Gorillaz content before the three-year hiatus.

Transmissions:

Murdoc’s announcement
Save the date!!!
Murdoc announces Gorillaz collaborators
A camera crew pay a visit to Gorillaz HQ
DoYaThing is OUT NOW!
Countdown to DoYaThing video begins!
DoYaThing video released on 29th Feb!!!
DoYaThing video released today!
DoYaThing extended version out NOW!
Sayonara from Murdoc Niccals!
